antichess.viewgui
Interface BoardView

All Known Implementing Classes:
ChessBoardView
public interface BoardView

BoardView is a container for rendering Boards and accept input. It is an abstract class that is meant to be subclassed by classes that are meant to render specific types of Boards.

Author:
nlharr
Specification Fields
  • acceptingInput //boolean that stores whether the BoardView is accepting input //boardPlayer.setView(args) can only be called by this BoardView //when acceptingInput == true
  • boardPlayer //the HumanPlayer that is requesting inputr from the BoardView
  • viewedBoard //the board that this BoardView is displaying

Method Summary
 void postRefresh()
          Notifies the BoardView that the board has changed
 void setAcceptingInput(HumanPlayer humanPlayer)
          Sets the BoardView to accept input from the humanPlayer If the BoardView is already accepting input this call does nothing
 void setNotAcceptingInput()
          Sets the BoardView to not accept input from the humanPlayer If the BoardView is already not accepting input this call does nothing
 

Method Detail

setAcceptingInput

void setAcceptingInput(HumanPlayer humanPlayer)
Sets the BoardView to accept input from the humanPlayer If the BoardView is already accepting input this call does nothing

Effects:
acceptingInput = true, boardPlayer = humanPlayer
Modifies:
acceptingInput, boardPlayer

setNotAcceptingInput

void setNotAcceptingInput()
Sets the BoardView to not accept input from the humanPlayer If the BoardView is already not accepting input this call does nothing

Effects:
acceptingInput = false
Modifies:
acceptingInput

postRefresh

void postRefresh()
Notifies the BoardView that the board has changed
